title: Radial Forearm Flap for Hand Reconstruction
technique_summary: Radial forearm free flap harvested with 12cm pedicle length. Anastomosis to radial artery and cephalic vein. Primary closure of donor site with split-thickness skin graft.
complications: Minor wound dehiscence at donor site, resolved with local care
notes: Patient had excellent vascular anatomy. Post-op Doppler monitoring showed good flow.
imaging_meta: CT angiogram showed patent radial artery, no anomalies

title: Anterolateral Thigh Flap for Lower Leg Defect
technique_summary: ALT flap harvested as musculocutaneous flap, 18x12cm. Perforator-based design. Anastomosis to posterior tibial vessels. Donor site closed primarily.
complications: Partial flap loss (20%) requiring debridement and secondary closure
notes: Smoking history may have contributed to complications. Patient counseled on smoking cessation.
imaging_meta: MRI showed adequate perforator anatomy. Pre-op Doppler mapping performed

title: Latissimus Dorsi Flap for Chest Wall Reconstruction
technique_summary: Pedicled latissimus dorsi myocutaneous flap, 15x10cm. Tunneled subcutaneously to anterior chest. No microvascular anastomosis required.
notes: Excellent functional outcome. Patient returned to full activity at 6 weeks.
imaging_meta: Chest CT showed adequate muscle bulk. No vascular anomalies

title: Gracilis Muscle Flap for Perineal Reconstruction
technique_summary: Gracilis muscle flap harvested from right thigh. Transposed to perineal defect. Split-thickness skin graft applied over muscle.
notes: Good coverage achieved. Patient satisfied with cosmetic result.
imaging_meta: Pre-op MRI confirmed adequate gracilis muscle volume

title: Fibula Free Flap for Mandibular Reconstruction
technique_summary: Fibula osteocutaneous free flap, 12cm bone segment with 8x6cm skin paddle. Anastomosis to facial artery and vein. Mandibular reconstruction plate applied.
complications: Delayed wound healing at recipient site, no flap loss
notes: Smoking cessation program initiated pre-operatively. Patient reduced but did not quit completely.
imaging_meta: CT angiogram showed three-vessel runoff in leg. Pre-op vascular mapping performed
